Yes, that's correct. If you set `max-height` to a value that is too low, the image may still display at a larger size than you intend.

When you set `max-height` to a percentage value, the height of the element will be limited to a percentage of its parent element. So if the parent element has a large height, setting `max-height` to a small percentage will still result in a large image.

To limit the height of the image more precisely, you can use an absolute value for `max-height`, such as pixels or ems. This will limit the height of the image to a fixed size regardless of the size of the parent element.
